course.title: Europe on Trial: Retribution, Renewal and Reconciliation Since 1945
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., at 11, and a weekly section to be arranged
course.description: This course examines Europe from the aftermath of the world's most destructive war to today's euro crisis. Using the idea of "trials" both literally and figuratively, we will address the major themes of postwar retribution, the Cold War, decolonization, new social movements, the fall of Communism, the expanding European Union, and the dilemmas facing a pluralist and postcolonial Europe. The roles of vigilante justice, terrorism, social justice and economic welfare will also be explored. Students will study the transcripts and accounts of political trials to examine how these themes occurred and recurred in post-war Europe.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
